DOC.brief_summary: The treatment burden for patients with cystic fibrosis (CF) is significant and poor adherence has been well-documented. The investigators hypothesize that a health coaching intervention will empower young adults with CF to manage their lives with CF and improve health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The main aim of the study is to establish the feasibility and acceptability of a Motivational Interviewing inspired coaching-intervention.
DOC.brief_title: A Coaching Intervention to Young Adults With Cystic Fibrosis
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed with cystic fibrosis (CF), confirmed by clinical findings, identification of two diseasecausing CF mutations, and a positive sweat test Patient at the Copenhagen CF Centre Severe intellectual impairment or insufficient mastery of the Danish language, determined by incapacity to independently complete the questionnaires
